# stochastic.isotropic { #stochastic.isotropic }

```python
isotropic(size, method='rademacher', seed=None, dtype=np.float64)
```

Generates random vectors from a specified isotropic distribution.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                    | Description                                                                         | Default        |
|--------|-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|
| size   | Union\[int, tuple\]                     | Output shape to generate.                                                           | _required_     |
| method | str                                     | Isotropic distribution to sample from. Must be "rademacher", "sphere", or "normal". | `'rademacher'` |
| seed   | Union\[int, np.random.Generator, None\] | Seed or generator for pseudo random number generation. .                            | `None`         |
| dtype  | np.dtype                                | dtype for the output. Must be float32 or float64.                                   | `np.float64`   |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type       | Description                                                                              |
|--------|------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | np.ndarray | Randomly generated array of shape `size` with entries distributed according to `method`. |
